1. Introduction

Welcome to YouthSpark. We are committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the security of your personal information. This Privacy Policy explains how YouthSpark ("we," "us," or "our"), a registered non-governmental organization (NGO) in India, collects, uses, discloses, and safeguards your information when you visit our website or use our services.

By accessing or using our services, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by this Privacy Policy. If you do not agree with our policies and practices, please do not use our services.

Data Controller: YouthSpark, 123 Youth Street, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500034, India

2. Information We Collect

We collect several types of information from and about users of our website and services:

2.1 Personal Information

Information that identifies you as an individual, including:

  • Full name
  • Email address
  • Phone number
  • Mailing address
  • Date of birth
  • Emergency contact information

2.2 Program-Related Information

  • Program enrollment details
  • Counseling session notes (with consent)
  • Educational background
  • Employment information
  • Health information (only when necessary for recovery programs)

2.3 Technical Information

  • IP address
  • Browser type and version
  • Device information
  • Pages visited and time spent
  • Referral sources

2.4 Voluntary Information

Information you provide when you:

  • Fill out forms on our website
  • Subscribe to newsletters
  • Download resources
  • Participate in surveys or feedback forms
  • Contact us through email, phone, or social media

3. How We Use Your Information

We use the information we collect for the following purposes:

  • Service Delivery: To provide counseling, mentorship, and support programs
  • Communication: To respond to inquiries, send updates, and provide program information
  • Program Improvement: To analyze and improve our services and programs
  • Safety and Security: To protect the safety of our participants and staff
  • Legal Compliance: To comply with applicable laws and regulations
  • Research: To conduct research for program development (anonymized data only)
  • Marketing: To send newsletters and updates about our programs (with your consent)
  • Event Management: To organize workshops, seminars, and community events

4. Data Sharing and Disclosure

We do not sell, trade, or rent your personal information to third parties. We may share your information only in the following circumstances:

4.1 With Your Consent

When you explicitly authorize us to share specific information with third parties.

4.2 Service Providers

We may share information with trusted third-party service providers who assist us in:

  • Website hosting and maintenance
  • Email delivery services
  • Analytics and performance monitoring
  • Payment processing (for donations)

4.3 Legal Requirements

We may disclose your information if required by law or in response to:

  • Court orders or legal processes
  • Government or regulatory requests
  • Protection of rights, property, or safety
  • Emergency situations involving imminent harm

4.4 Partner Organizations

With partner NGOs or healthcare providers only when necessary for program delivery and with your explicit consent.

5. Data Security

We implement appropriate technical and organizational security measures to protect your personal information, including:

  • Encryption of data in transit and at rest
  • Secure server infrastructure
  • Access controls and authentication
  • Regular security audits and updates
  • Staff training on data protection
  • Confidential handling of sensitive program information

While we strive to protect your information, no method of electronic transmission or storage is 100% secure. We cannot guarantee absolute security but continuously work to maintain the highest standards.

6. Your Privacy Rights

You have the following rights regarding your personal information:

  • Access: Request a copy of the personal information we hold about you
  • Correction: Request correction of inaccurate or incomplete information
  • Deletion: Request deletion of your personal information (subject to legal obligations)
  • Restriction: Request restriction of processing in certain circumstances
  • Objection: Object to processing based on legitimate interests
  • Portability: Request transfer of your data to another organization
  • Withdraw Consent: Withdraw consent for data processing at any time
  • Opt-Out: Unsubscribe from marketing communications

To exercise any of these rights, please contact us at help@youthspark.org or call +91 98765 43210.

7. Children's Privacy

YouthSpark serves young people, including minors under the age of 18. We take special care to protect the privacy of children and adolescents:

  • For participants under 18, we obtain parental or guardian consent before collecting personal information
  • We collect only the minimum information necessary for program participation
  • Parents/guardians have the right to review, modify, or delete their child's information
  • All counseling and program information involving minors is kept strictly confidential
  • We do not share children's information with third parties without parental consent

If you believe we have collected information from a child without proper consent, please contact us immediately at help@youthspark.org.

8. Cookies and Tracking Technologies

Our website uses cookies and similar tracking technologies to enhance user experience and analyze website performance.

8.1 Types of Cookies We Use

  • Essential Cookies: Necessary for website functionality
  • Analytics Cookies: Help us understand how visitors use our website
  • Preference Cookies: Remember your settings and preferences
  • Marketing Cookies: Track effectiveness of campaigns (with consent)

8.2 Managing Cookies

You can control cookies through your browser settings. Note that disabling certain cookies may affect website functionality.

9. Data Retention

We retain your personal information only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy, unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law.

  • Active Participants: Duration of program participation plus 3 years
  • Newsletter Subscribers: Until you unsubscribe
  • Contact Inquiries: Up to 2 years after last communication
  • Legal Requirements: As required by applicable laws and regulations
  • Anonymized Data: May be retained indefinitely for research purposes

10. Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices, technology, legal requirements, or other factors.

When we make changes, we will:

  • Update the "Last Updated" date at the top of this policy
  • Notify you via email if changes are significant
  • Post a notice on our website homepage
  • Obtain your consent if required by law

We encourage you to review this Privacy Policy periodically to stay informed about how we protect your information.
